meanings.definition: Following one after another in order.
meanings.sent1: She won five consecutive games in a row.
meanings.sent2: The team scored consecutive goals in the second half.
meanings.sent3: The consecutive wins put a big smile on her face.
meanings.sent4: His consecutive absences from work raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's consecutive praises motivated the students to do better.

meanings.sent1: He ran consecutive laps around the track without stopping.
meanings.sent2: The music played consecutive songs without any breaks.
meanings.sent3: She danced so fast, almost consecutively, that it looked like a blur.
meanings.sent4: The ideas flowed out of her mind consecutively, like a river.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked consecutively, marking each passing second.
